Black hack, white hack, macchiato monsters, WOD,  DW Lite.... Are there any of this ilk that I am missing? 
<div id='comment z12aw3vqzzqoynbq304cftxpikirjhdp5mw0k'>
  <h4><img src='{{site.baseurl}}//images/avatars/114565208078196505939_photo.jpg'> Charles Gatz</h4>

        <p>&quot;The Indie Hack&quot; traces its roots to Black Hack.</p>
</div>

<div id='comment z12aw3vqzzqoynbq304cftxpikirjhdp5mw0k'>
  <h4><img src='{{site.baseurl}}//images/avatars/110301622772119888974_photo.jpg'> Andrew Huffaker</h4>
      <p><cite>2017-08-25 19:23:03 (edited: 2017-08-25 19:23:03)</cite></p>
        <p>Are there anymore &#39;hacks&#39; or these kind of 50 page Lite kind of games that you know of or like?</p>
</div>
        

<div id='comment z12aw3vqzzqoynbq304cftxpikirjhdp5mw0k'>
  <h4><img src='{{site.baseurl}}//images/avatars/105116536507539796451_photo.jpg'> Morten Halvorsen</h4>
      <p><cite>2017-08-25 19:25:51 (edited: 2017-08-25 19:25:51)</cite></p>
        <p>World of Dungeons ?</p>
</div>
        

<div id='comment z12aw3vqzzqoynbq304cftxpikirjhdp5mw0k'>
  <h4><img src='{{site.baseurl}}//images/avatars/101025241405784788544_photo.jpg'> Michael Prescott</h4>
      <p><cite>2017-08-25 19:28:06 (edited: 2017-08-25 19:28:06)</cite></p>
        <p><span class="proflinkWrapper"><span class="proflinkPrefix">+</span><a class="proflink" href="https://plus.google.com/105116536507539796451" oid="105116536507539796451">Morten Halvorsen</a></span> I <i>think</i> that&#39;s the &#39;WOD&#39; in the OP.</p>
</div>
        

<div id='comment z12aw3vqzzqoynbq304cftxpikirjhdp5mw0k'>
  <h4><img src='{{site.baseurl}}//images/avatars/104675236432730777219_photo.jpg'> John at Deep Six Delver</h4>
      <p><cite>2017-08-25 19:31:53 (edited: 2017-08-25 19:31:53)</cite></p>
        <p>World of Mutants<br /><a href="http://www.onesevendesign.com/dw/world_of_mutants_2-up.pdf" class="ot-anchor">http://www.onesevendesign.com/dw/world_of_mutants_2-up.pdf</a><br />World of Dungeons: Turbo<br /><a href="http://onesevendesign.com/breakers_wodu_turbo.pdf" class="ot-anchor">http://onesevendesign.com/breakers_wodu_turbo.pdf</a></p>
</div>
        

<div id='comment z12aw3vqzzqoynbq304cftxpikirjhdp5mw0k'>
  <h4><img src='{{site.baseurl}}//images/avatars/114509048514338523214_photo.jpg'> Max Vanderheyden</h4>
      <p><cite>2017-08-25 19:55:57 (edited: 2017-08-25 20:08:15)</cite></p>
        <p><b>Portal Rats</b> by <span class="proflinkWrapper"><span class="proflinkPrefix">+</span><a class="proflink" href="https://plus.google.com/110506439354107775385" oid="110506439354107775385">Tore Nielsen</a></span> and <span class="proflinkWrapper"><span class="proflinkPrefix">+</span><a class="proflink" href="https://plus.google.com/113791301101587397985" oid="113791301101587397985">Neal Stidham</a></span> is a hack with a Planescape feeling. Really cool<br /><br />I +1&#39;d <b>Maze Rats</b> but I feel it deserves to be re-mentioned as it is awesome. Kudos to <span class="proflinkWrapper"><span class="proflinkPrefix">+</span><a class="proflink" href="https://plus.google.com/100784288559145414228" oid="100784288559145414228">Ben Milton</a></span><br /><br /><b>Troika!</b> is in your page range and is a great lite-weight game that is substantially different from most of the other games listed here. <span class="proflinkWrapper"><span class="proflinkPrefix">+</span><a class="proflink" href="https://plus.google.com/100700922193203314528" oid="100700922193203314528">Daniel Sell</a></span><br /><br /><b>Stay Frosty</b> is a hack where you play Space Marines(ish) in scenarios influenced by movies like <i>Starship Troopers, Predator, Alien, The Thing</i> <span class="proflinkWrapper"><span class="proflinkPrefix">+</span><a class="proflink" href="https://plus.google.com/110773650362547171117" oid="110773650362547171117">Casey G.</a></span></p>
</div>
        

<div id='comment z12aw3vqzzqoynbq304cftxpikirjhdp5mw0k'>
  <h4><img src='{{site.baseurl}}//images/avatars/107323876295285638890_photo.jpg'> Benjamin Kramer (Photostyle)</h4>
      <p><cite>2017-08-25 20:05:47 (edited: 2017-08-25 20:05:47)</cite></p>
        <p>The Rad Hack</p>
</div>
        

<div id='comment z12aw3vqzzqoynbq304cftxpikirjhdp5mw0k'>
  <h4><img src='{{site.baseurl}}//images/avatars/104675236432730777219_photo.jpg'> John at Deep Six Delver</h4>
      <p><cite>2017-08-25 20:20:40 (edited: 2017-08-25 20:20:40)</cite></p>
        <p>Old School Hack!<br />- <a href="http://www.oldschoolhack.net/osh-docs/OldSchoolHack_v1beta.pdf" class="ot-anchor">http://www.oldschoolhack.net/osh-docs/OldSchoolHack_v1beta.pdf</a><br />- <a href="http://www.oldschoolhack.net" data-embed="" data-attachment-render-hint="1" class="ot-anchor">http://www.oldschoolhack.net</a><br /><br />OSH is not like the recent spate of games that have &quot;Hack&quot; in the name, but it is an excellent little game that produces non-stop, glorious, over-the-top, antic-driven action.</p>
</div>
        

<div id='comment z12aw3vqzzqoynbq304cftxpikirjhdp5mw0k'>
  <h4><img src='{{site.baseurl}}//images/avatars/104219282502793301924_photo.jpg'> Charlie Vick</h4>
      <p><cite>2017-08-25 20:33:50 (edited: 2017-08-25 20:34:22)</cite></p>
        <p>Into the Odd is really keen. No to-hit rolls speed up combat, the fact that damage applies to your HP and then STR stat is nice (and you&#39;re making a roll-under strength check after the damage to stay up, which is nice - party &#39;wipe&#39; means that everyone got hurt and lost consciousness, but they can potentially wake up in a worse situation if that&#39;s what the enemies would do). Has a more industrial vibe than some of the other straight-fantasy options.<br /><br />Blood of Pangea might be to your liking. PCs are described in a few short sentences, the traits/facts written can then be used to give a bonus to the game&#39;s 2d6 rolls. The system uses a few classes: warriors, thieves, and wizardlings. It has aspirations towards more of a Conan-and-Elric vibe. The same publisher put out Pits and Perils (more traditional DnD fantasy setting, stats-less, has classes, 2d6 only, quite nice). And Diceless Dungeons, which has some resource-management and traits-based stuff, but otherwise there&#39;s no randomization in what happens, just narration and negotiation. The Sneaky character can normally sneak, the Bookish character probably knows something from a book about this, etc. It&#39;s definitely kindled an interest in diceless rpgs for me. <br /><br />Streets of Mos Eisley is a Star Wars WOD hack with some conditions a la Lady Blackbird. Dark Heart of the Dreamer and Planes of Dungeons are World of Dungeons hacks for Planescapery. <br /><br />I second the Rad-Hack as it is great, has a free SRD on github, and does all the Mad Max / Gamma World stuff that you could want from The Black Hack.</p>
</div>
        

<div id='comment z12aw3vqzzqoynbq304cftxpikirjhdp5mw0k'>
  <h4><img src='{{site.baseurl}}//images/avatars/107921460605994366874_photo.jpg'> Jason Tocci</h4>
      <p><cite>2017-08-25 21:24:22 (edited: 2017-08-25 21:24:22)</cite></p>
        <p>Exemplars &amp; Eidolons, by the author of Stars Without Number, is a wee free old school fantasy hack that doubles as an annotated design template and master class in book design.<br /><br />Searchers of the Unknown is collected free with a ton of neat little lightweight hacks as well. Characters&#39; stats are basically just boiled down to HP, move rate, and AC doubling as both durability (if low) and maneuverability (if high).</p>
</div>
        

<div id='comment z12aw3vqzzqoynbq304cftxpikirjhdp5mw0k'>
  <h4><img src='{{site.baseurl}}//images/avatars/108131264929529993281_photo.jpg'> Lester Ward</h4>

</div>
